info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 3:45AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...PATCHY FREEZING FOG AND DENSE FOG POSSIBLE EARLY THIS MORNING AROUND THE NORTHERN UPSTATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA... Fog is expected to continue expanding across portions of the northern Upstate early this morning. The fog may become locally dense, reducing visibility to 1/4 mile or less. Temperatures are also expected to cool to the lower 30s. In areas where fog is dense, water droplets may freeze on elevated surfaces. A few slick spots could therefore develop on bridges and overpasses by the time of the morning commute. Patchy dense fog, reducing visibility to 1/4 mile or less, will also create adverse driving conditions through daybreak. The fog is expected to gradually dissipate from the northwest, and most areas should see the fog dissipate by shortly after sunrise. Motorists traveling across the Piedmont, Upstate, and the Charlotte metro area early this morning should slow down, use low beam headlights and allow for plenty of distance between yourself and other vehicles.
